about.name: Bangkok
about.info_text: Bangkok, the capital of Thailand, is a bustling metropolis known for its rich cultural heritage, vibrant street life, and modern skyscrapers. The city offers a unique blend of traditional Thai culture and contemporary urban experiences. Visitors can explore ancient temples, savor delicious street food, shop at bustling markets, and enjoy a thriving nightlife scene. Bangkok is a city of contrasts, where ornate temples stand beside sleek malls, and the Chao Phraya River winds through the heart of the city.
about.facts_text:
Population: Approximately 8.3 million
Province: Bangkok
Time Zone: Indochina Time (UTC+07:00)
Language: Thai
Currency: Thai Baht (THB)
about.climate_text: Bangkok has a tropical monsoon climate with three distinct seasons: hot, wet, and cool. The best time to visit is during the cool and dry season from November to February when the weather is more pleasant.

attractions_card.title: Grand Palace
attractions_card.description: The Grand Palace is a stunning complex of royal and religious buildings, including the famous Wat Phra Kaew (Temple of the Emerald Buddha). It's a must-visit for its architectural beauty and cultural significance.

attractions_card.title: Wat Pho
attractions_card.description: Wat Pho, also known as the Temple of the Reclining Buddha, is famous for its enormous golden statue of a reclining Buddha and traditional Thai massage school.

attractions_card.title: Chatuchak Weekend Market
attractions_card.description: Chatuchak Market is one of the world's largest weekend markets, offering a wide range of products, from clothing and accessories to handicrafts and street food.

attractions_card.title: Asiatique The Riverfront
attractions_card.description: Asiatique is a vibrant night market located along the Chao Phraya River. It features boutique shops, restaurants, and entertainment options with great views of the river.

attractions_card.title: Khao San Road
attractions_card.description: Khao San Road is a famous backpacker street known for its lively nightlife, street vendors, bars, and budget accommodations.

attractions_card.title: Jim Thompson House
attractions_card.description: The Jim Thompson House is a museum showcasing the traditional Thai-style houses and the art collection of the American silk entrepreneur Jim Thompson.

attractions_card.title: Erawan Shrine
attractions_card.description: The Erawan Shrine is a Hindu shrine famous for its spiritual significance and traditional dance performances that take place in the vicinity.

attractions_card.title: Lumphini Park
attractions_card.description: Lumphini Park is an urban oasis offering green spaces, a large lake, and opportunities for jogging, picnics, and paddle boating.

food_card.title: Pad Thai
food_card.description: Pad Thai is a classic Thai dish made with stir-fried rice noodles, shrimp or chicken, tofu, peanuts, and a flavorful tamarind sauce.

food_card.title: Tom Yum Soup
food_card.description: Tom Yum is a hot and sour Thai soup made with lemongrass, kaffir lime leaves, and a combination of shrimp, chicken, or mushrooms.

food_card.title: Green Curry
food_card.description: Green Curry is a popular Thai dish made with green curry paste, coconut milk, and a variety of vegetables and proteins, such as chicken or beef.

food_card.title: Mango Sticky Rice
food_card.description: Mango Sticky Rice is a beloved Thai dessert made with ripe mangoes, glutinous rice, and coconut milk, creating a sweet and creamy treat.

food_card.title: Som Tum
food_card.description: Som Tum is a spicy green papaya salad that's a staple of Thai cuisine, offering a mix of flavors, including sweet, sour, and spicy.

hotels_card.title: Mandarin Oriental, Bangkok
hotels_card.description: The Mandarin Oriental is a legendary luxury hotel located along the Chao Phraya River, offering elegant accommodations and exceptional service.

hotels_card.title: Banyan Tree Bangkok
hotels_card.description: Banyan Tree is a stylish urban resort with panoramic city views, luxurious rooms, and a rooftop restaurant and bar.

hotels_card.title: Amari Watergate Bangkok
hotels_card.description: Amari Watergate is a contemporary hotel in the Pratunam shopping district, offering comfortable rooms, a rooftop pool, and multiple dining options.

hotels_card.title: Shangri-La Hotel, Bangkok
hotels_card.description: The Shangri-La Hotel provides a riverside retreat with luxurious amenities, beautiful gardens, and a range of dining experiences.

hotels_card.title: Centara Grand at CentralWorld
hotels_card.description: Centara Grand is a modern hotel connected to CentralWorld shopping mall, offering comfortable rooms and rooftop dining with city views.

transport_card.title: BTS Skytrain
transport_card.description: The BTS Skytrain is a convenient and efficient way to navigate Bangkok's traffic, with routes connecting major areas of the city.

transport_card.title: MRT Subway
transport_card.description: The MRT Subway is another rapid transit system that complements the BTS, providing access to various parts of the city.

transport_card.title: Tuk-Tuk
transport_card.description: Tuk-Tuks are a popular and iconic mode of transportation in Bangkok, often used for short trips within the city.

transport_card.title: Suvarnabhumi Airport
transport_card.description: Suvarnabhumi Airport (BKK) is Bangkok's main international airport, located about 25 kilometers east of the city center.
